alert.note: Alert for Chambers; Coosa; Randolph; Tallapoosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 3:14PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Randolph, northern Tallapoosa, northwestern Chambers and southeastern Coosa Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 314 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Abanda to near Highway 9 and Highway 22. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alexander City, Roanoke, Dadeville, Stroud, Jacksons` Gap, New Site, Wadley, Abanda, Standing Rock, Nixburg, Welch, Trammel Crossroads, Hillabee Creek, Northern Lake Martin, Crystal Lake, Wind Creek State Park, Penton, Sparkling Springs, Eastern Lake Martin and Western Lake Martin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for east central Alabama.
